Title: DashMart Team Member - Southcenter
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

Were excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties, including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

Title: Vendor Operations Project Supervisor (Merchant Support)
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Vendor Operations team within the Merchant Experience organization is responsible for managing the day-to-day operations and performance of our offshore vendor partners. These vendors are critical to our success, delivering high-quality solutions across key process flows, strategic initiatives, and support functions. We ensure that all vendor work meets our rigorous quality standards and service level agreements (SLAs), enabling smooth, scalable, and reliable operations.
Our Vendor Support cohort is entering an exciting phase of growth and transformation. As we expand our scope to include oversight of all outsourced Merchant Support operations, we have a unique opportunity to reimagine and enhance the foundation of our support model. By combining proven systems with innovative thinking and operational excellence, we are building a more robust and scalable support experience from the ground up. We're seeking a leader who thrives in dynamic environments and is energized by the challenge of driving impactful, transformative change.
About the Role
As a Project Supervisor for Vendor Support Operations, you will be on the front lines of our transition and transformation effort. Youll own the performance and accountability of vendor partners who handle merchant support interactions, ensuring they meet key metrics such as SLA compliance, QA, and operational throughput. Youll also lead the development and maintenance of our internal Knowledge Base, creating clarity and structure in a time of change.
This role isnt about inheriting a perfect systemits about stepping into a legacy structure and making it better. Youll need grit, strong operational instincts, and the ability to bring order to ambiguity. Youll act as a strategic thought partner, identifying gaps, proposing solutions, and helping us rebuild and scale merchant support processes for the future.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Help lead the transition of merchant support operations into a new organizational home
Assess inherited support workflows and recommend optimizations based on quality, efficiency, and scalability
Act as the primary liaison with external vendors, ensuring alignment on expectations, priorities, and execution
Drive performance through ownership of SLA tracking and feedback loops
Lead the buildout and ongoing improvement of the internal Knowledge Base, enabling vendor agents to work more accurately and independently
Identify process breakdowns and inefficiencies, and work cross-functionally to implement solutions
Serve as a trusted partner to internal teams like CX, Product, Strategy & Ops, Operations, and Audit during this transitional period
Help manage change across stakeholders and vendors, from documentation updates to rollout communications
Own progress tracking, vendor accountability, and performance reporting during a critical time of operational change

Were excited about you because you have...

35 years of experience in support operations, contact center/vendor management, or process improvement
Experience managing BPO vendors and driving accountability through metrics and structured feedback
A strong operational mindset and the confidence to lead through complexity and change
Experience building or maintaining Knowledge Bases and documentation processes at scale
A data-driven approach, with proficiency in Google Sheets (including pivot tables, formulas, and data validation) or similar BI/reporting tools
Excellent communication skills and the ability to build trust quickly with cross-functional and vendor partners
A bias toward action and comfort operating in ambiguous, rapidly changing environments
Strong prioritization and project management skillsyou can juggle multiple initiatives without losing sight of the big picture
Familiarity with CX or support platforms like Salesforce, or similar systems is a plus

Title: Representative, Community Defense
RoleDescription:
At DoorDash, we believe in fostering a culture of meaningful connection, collaboration, and professional growth through in-office interactions. This position requires an in-office presence at the DoorDash corporate office in Tempe and the employee must live within a commutable 50 miles from the office. In-office days are determined by the business and can change based on business needs. Connect with the recruiter to determine what the in-office requirement for this role is.
About the Team
The Community Defense team improves the quality of DoorDash operations through the adjudication of background checks, inbound appeals and support inquiries, and screening-related functions. On-demand food delivery has many advantages; however, there are extremely challenging logistics to ensure DoorDash is delivering the best service to the Customers, Dashers, and Merchants.
Community Defense presents a united front to protect the experience of Customers, Merchants, and Dashers while solving these logistical challenges. This teams work helps in maintaining and building internal and external relationships while protecting DoorDashs brand. We work with our stakeholders to solve and mitigate escalations, monitor day-to-day quality, improve response times, and drive tool usage and efficiencies. This position is a tremendous opportunity to join a fast-growing team that is hyper-focused on improving the quality of DoorDashs operations.
About the Role
The Community Defense Representative is a high-bandwidth, meticulously organized individual, who can balance both high volume production and a great attention to detail. They know when to escalate appropriately and ask for help. This position calls for a self-starter who wants to innovate and be part of a dynamic, fast-moving team. 
You will report into a Team Lead of Community Defense in our Global Support and Integrity Operations Organization.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Improve our operational and safety processes so we can deliver high quality support to all portions of our business. 
Be responsible for components of projects and processes that directly contribute to the safety of the DoorDash platform.
Help research and implement best practices as we build our team.
Work across a number of diverse workflows and gain exposure and experience within the compliance industry
Develop expertise in how DoorDash's processes and resources work, and how to use them to promote positive outcomes
Demonstrate relationship-building with peers and company leaders

We're excited about you because... 

You are an owner, always looking for opportunities to better your work product
You are comfortable making tough decisions that balance the trade-off between quality and quantity
You have a mind and talent for process improvement
You have experience in pulling and using data to influence your decisions
Experience with adjudications, case work and government documents
You have knowledge of Salesforce and Excel (can maintain complex spreadsheets)/Google Sheets (preferred)
You have experience in the trust and safety, compliance, and/or regulatory industries (preferred)
You have familiarity with working with large, diverse customer support, operations, and sales organizations (preferred)

SevenRooms is hiring a remote Technical Support Engineer to manage and solve client support cases. Reporting directly to the Senior Director of Engineering, you will leverage technology and software to solve problems and maximize productivity and efficiency for our clients.

Must have solid understanding of Javascript

Excellent verbal and written communication

Were looking for a strong developer who is excited to engineer highly performant, mission-critical systems that are designed for agile development and rapid scaling. You will partner with other engineers, product managers and designers who are dedicated to engineering real solutions that empower SevenRooms for growth. You're excited about this opportunity because...

Engineering: Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and improve software with a strong focus on customer-facing features
Product Focus: Be the technical owner of features, from design to implementation to ongoing support
Project Management: Manage individual project priorities, deadlines, code quality and deliverables; Participate in occasional on-call duties to keep software systems up and running

Experience with algorithms, data structures, complexity analysis and software design
3+ years of software engineering experience

Title: Site Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is part of the New Verticals division with Doordash and we are a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. 
About the Role
In this role, youll manage a 5-15k sq ft distribution center, the local warehouse operating team, and be responsible for ensuring we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Recruit, lead, coach & retain a high-performing team of Shift Leads (3+) and Operations Associates (6+). Set your team up for success to work safely and productively. As a leader, you will be responsible for building a strong, positive culture and will be accountable for driving strong employee satisfaction scores. Youll partner with your Shift Leads to effectively delegate daily tasks and ensure high performance from your team. 
Own: You will own the day-to-day operations of one of our DashMart warehouses, and in some locations, includes preparing food in a light-prep kitchen, ensuring the site processes run smoothly, efficiently and safely. Youll own scheduling and be responsible for managing a labor budget. You will be responsible for ensuring your warehouse meets site-level metric goals. 
Delight customers: Lead your team in providing our customers with the best possible experience on each and every order. You will be responsible for maintaining key quality metrics including order accuracy and fulfillment speed. Work cross-functionally with central teams including our inventory and training teams to provide your team with the tools and resources to achieve this goal.  
Strategize: Use data to identify pain-points or areas of inefficiency within our warehouse and current processes. Design, build and execute process improvement projects to improve our warehouse operations, quality metrics, and the employee experience.

Were excited about you because... 

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 10+ employees
You act like an owner. You do what it takes to support a 24/7 business across multiple shifts. Youre excited to have ownership over a new and rapidly growing business.
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking

Title: Senior Product Designer, New Bets
Location: San Francisco, CA; Sunnyvale, CA; New York, NY; Seattle, WA
RoleDescription:
About the Team
At DoorDash, our customers are at the center of our product strategy and we believe that an amazing customer experience is the key to our success. The Consumer team designs the mobile apps and website that millions of customers use every day to order meals and more from their favorite local merchants.
Within the Consumer team, the New Bets group explores how DoorDash can support dining beyond delivery and beyond the homethink pickup, reservations, dine-in experiences, and more. This team is pioneering the future of how people interact with food and restaurants through hybrid physical/digital experiences. If you are passionate about creating 01 products and expanding what it means to DoorDash it, this role is for you!
About the Role
We're in search of a Senior Product Designer to become a foundational member of our innovative New Bets team. You will have the unique opportunity to define and shape entirely new customer experiences that connect people with dining in non-traditional contexts. Whether its helping customers skip the line for a dine-in experience, reserve a table and pre-order, or discover new local gems for pickup, you'll help DoorDash unlock value far beyond the doorstep.
This position is open for candidates in San Francisco, Sunnyvale, Seattle, or New York and will report to the Sr. Design Manager of New Bets within our Consumer design organization. This role follows a hybrid work model, blending in-office and remote collaboration.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Contribute directly to DoorDash's consumer product strategy and define the future of dining experiences.
Explore complex, ambiguous problem spacesworking with your team to understand user behavior and uncover new opportunities.
Translate early-stage concepts into thoughtful end-to-end experiences using wireframes, prototypes, and high-fidelity design.
Influence how the team builds, from shaping the roadmap to improving team rituals and design quality.
Improve the lives of millions of DoorDash customers by giving them more ways to discover and enjoy dining.

We're excited about you because... 

You have 5+ years of work experience and a strong portfolio showcasing exceptional product design work, especially in new, 01 product spaces.
You approach design as a craft, sweat the details, and strive to push the quality bar higher with every release.
Youre a strong storyteller who can clearly articulate your design rationale and influence cross-functional partners.
You thrive in ambiguity, embrace first principles thinking, and arent afraid to explore unconventional ideas.

Title: Senior Associate, Drive - Retail B2B Strategy & Operations
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Drive is our hyper-growth fulfillment platform (white-label delivery) serving restaurants, grocers and retailers across the United States, Canada, Australia and Japan.  The Drive Retail team is a line-of-business within Drive and has the vision to be the #1 local delivery provider that gives our retail partners a competitive advantage by offering white-label deliveries at unparalleled quality and speed that their end customers love
About the Role
We are looking for a hands-on builder for a key pillar of our Retail B2B team. You will help grow and scale one of our big bets, expanding into B2B fulfillment.  You will make recommendations based on data on how to grow and optimize the business and support processes; will work directly with our internal cross-functional partners to ensure our quality is unmatched and with external partners to strengthen our relationship while helping drive our top-level business objectives.  
This role reports directly to the Manager of Strategy & Operations for Retail.  We have designed this role to have increased scope and responsibility that are unlocked as the business continues its growth trajectory and as you demonstrate and grow your own capabilities.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Analyze  Create the analytics infrastructure, metrics, and tools to grow and support our most important partners as well as uncover new opportunities to drive growth
Build  Drive the development of new tools and processes for managing Merchant growth in the growing Retail business
Strategize  Understand the needs of our partners, prioritize those needs by impact, and create solutions with cross-functional partners
Influence  Work cross-functionally with our Product, Logistics, and Business Development teams to make sure our partners have the best possible experience when using DoorDash's services

We're excited about you because...

You bring structure to chaos and ambiguity.  Youre excited to solve big, challenging problems and are able to navigate the unknown.
Youre an analytical powerhouse.  You let data win arguments, and youre comfortable with modeling in Excel. Experience with SQL and data visualization tools (ex. Tableau & Mode) is advantageous. 
You act with urgency.  Speed excites you. You prefer an accomplishment today to an accomplishment tomorrow.
You are a builder. You enjoy building from the ground up and excel in creating structure and process.
You have 3+ years of experience.  Youve succeeded in a competitive and fast moving environment such as consulting / banking / technology / analytics where you were expected to be self-driven with a bias-to-action; experience in a customer-facing or relationship management role is advantageous.

Title: Lead, Finance Systems
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The IT Enterprise Applications Engineering team manages and builds back-office applications, middleware, and integrations (HR, Finance, process automation, system integration). This team partners closely with our HR and Finance teams to build the systems that enable business processes.
We move fast and have audacious goals, scaling to meet the demands of a global enterprise that has grown multiple folds. 
About the Role
In this role, youll lead a small team of finance BSAs that build and maintain the back-end and automations for Finance systems plus support Finance systems on a daily basis (Coupa, Zip, BREX, IntelAgree, High Radius, IBM TM1, etc.).
Youll be the thought leader who partners with our Finance leaders from Procure to Pay, Sourcing and Accounting to build a shared technology roadmap, architects key system components, ensures the sustainability, scalability, and quality of our engineering efforts, and coaches and mentors the next generation of Finance BSAs.
You will report to the Leader of our IT Enterprise App Engineering team.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build the foundation for scale in all of our Finance technologies and develop the process and people necessary to ensure we can sustain excellence
Identifying opportunities to leverage AI and machine learning to streamline Finance processes, improve data accuracy, and enhance decision-making
Build strong relationships with our IT stakeholders by anticipating their needs and delivering before they ask
Continuously improve IT customer satisfaction by building a deep understanding of our customers experience and executing a support strategy that exceeds their expectations
Establish clear, measurable expectations for your team and provide the tools and the environment they need to meet those expectations
Utilize automation and process optimization to deliver 10x results with 2x investment, building scalability and flexibility into Finance technology engineering
Commit to inclusion both within your team and across functions, leading by example and ensuring everyone has a seat at the table and all voices are heard
Leverage Agile Principles to Plan, Manage and Execute sprints for various cross functional projects.  
Sound understanding of Finance systems Architecture, propose best design practices and solutions. 
Work closely with the Internal Audit, AP, Procurement team and other teams for quarterly SOX Audits.  

Were excited about you because...

You have 7+ years experience in Finance systems with 2+ years managing engineering teams
You have deep experience with Finance systems and integrations across all common systems (Coupa, BREX, Zip, High Radius, IBM TM1, etc.)
You have experience with supporting Direct/Indirect Procurement, AP, AR, Inventory Management, Fixed Assets, other.. processes and teams and a strong perspective on Build vs Buy. 
Experience with ERP finance modules including GL, AP, AR, Fixed Assets, Costing and Budgets
Youre capable of getting your hands dirty if needed, and you can move from a code review to an executive presentation seamlessly
Youve managed a remote workforce
You bring a modern mindset, with hands-on experience applying AI/ML in finance system workflows or are excited to drive these innovations forward

You will be joining a team of over 40 engineering professionals and reporting directly to our Chief Technology Officer.
You're excited about this opportunity because...

People Management: Manage a team of software engineers, including design and code review; Assist engineering leadership in developing a career framework for long term growth; Hire and enable talented engineers

Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Recruit, lead, coach & retain a high-performing team of Shift Leads (3+) and Operations Associates (6+). Set your team up for success to work safely and productively. Title: Electrical Engineering Technician
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDash Labs, established in 2018, serves as the innovation hub for DoorDash, focusing on developing automation and robotics solutions to enhance last-mile logistics. The team's mission is to create technologies that support and augment human networks, aiming to improve efficiency for Dashers, merchants, and consumers alike. Were ruthlessly focused on business impact. We are a highly senior team composed of former pioneers from a variety of different robotics industries. As of 2025, DoorDash has completed 10B lifetime deliveries. Were focused on how to do the next 10B even better.
About the Role
We are seeking a skilled Electrical Engineering Technician with expertise in PCB rework to support our Doordash Labs team. This role requires hands-on experience with printed circuit board (PCB) reworks, component replacement, and soldering in a high-precision environment. The technician will work closely with engineering teams to troubleshoot, modify, and rework boards, ensuring they meet exacting performance standards. You will report into Staff Electrical Engineer on our Electrical Engineering Team in our Labs Organization.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Perform precise soldering, desoldering, and replacement of SMT and through-hole components; restore damaged pads, traces, and vias using advanced techniques; handle fine-pitch and BGA components with high accuracy
Conduct visual inspections of PCBs; use oscilloscopes, DMMs, and other equipment to validate functionality and troubleshoot board-level issues post-rework.
Work closely with design/test engineers to align on rework specifications, provide design improvement feedback, and document all rework actions and findings.
 Continuously improve rework techniques and processes for better efficiency and quality; stay updated on the latest PCB rework tools and practices.
 Maintain detailed records of rework processes and changes made to PCB assemblies.

Were excited about you because...

You bring 2+ years of hands-on PCB rework experience, with a strong focus on SMT and BGA components, and you're ready to demonstrate your skills in our rework practice sessions during the interview
You are highly skilled in precision soldering techniques, including micro-soldering, enabling you to handle complex and delicate rework tasks with confidence.
You have a solid understanding of electronic testing tools and quality control processes, ensuring functional and reliable board-level repairs.
Your excellent manual dexterity and strong analytical and troubleshooting abilities allow you to work with accuracy while interpreting schematics, layouts, and specifications.
You are an effective communicator and documenter, capable of collaborating seamlessly with cross-functional engineering teams.

The DoorDash Recruiting Team is focused on building DoorDash culture, one quality hire at a time. 
We're looking for a Director of Technical Recruiting to lead our Engineering recruiting efforts. DoorDash is growing and scaling at an unprecedented rate, and you will play a critical role in shaping the technical recruiting function as we build to fully realize DoorDashs mission: to grow and empower local economies. Were focused on improvement  from moving faster to leveling up the quality of our product  and our work is never complete. If youre looking to define your career as part of something greater than yourself, come scale with us.

The Director of Technical Recruiting - Engineering will be responsible for developing and driving a scalable recruiting strategy to support our growing Engineering organization. In this role, youll lead hiring strategy and execution in close partnership with Engineering leadership.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead DoorDashs global engineering recruiting strategy with a focus on attracting top, diverse technical talent to meet both current and future organizational needs.
Manage and develop a high-performing, globally distributed team of Engineering Recruiting Managers and their teams.
Attract, grow, and retain recruiting talent across all levels, cultivating deep industry knowledge, operational rigor, and a culture of innovation.

Partner with cross-functional teams to amplify DoorDashs employment brand and build strategic engagement opportunities with prospective talent pools globally.

Title: Culinary Trainer Lead, Kitchens
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a new kind of online grocery store owned and operated  by DoorDash. Customers order their convenience, grocery and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members prepare, pick and pack orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store for our Dashers to deliver to our customers with quality and speed. Our customer promise is: Fresh, Local, and Reliable. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7! Dashmart Kitchens is a team within Dashmart focused on building and operating kitchens to bring fast, affordable restaurant and grocery selection to consumers. 
About the Role
Dashmart Kitchens is looking for a people-focused trainer who excels in a fast-paced, remote environment and is excited to roll up their sleeves and lead from the front. In this role, youll be helping us launch our Dashmart Kitchens, focusing on training local operators. You'll administer training and ongoing quality audits for multiple restaurant concepts - with the support of our Culinary, Kitchen Operations, and Project Management teams. You will report to the Head of Kitchen Operations.  

New Dashmart Kitchens Store Launches in the Field - Work hands-on with our Merchant Partners to administer training & support in the field, ensuring all managers and cooks are properly executing our recipes and following procedures. 
Ongoing Quality Auditing - Perform ongoing Host partnership visits and audits to ensure Hosts maintain consistent high-quality operations.

Youre excited about this opportunity because you...

Are passionate about working with people and love to be hands-on training with culinary teams
Love helping improve operations and contributing ideas to improve our training quality and onboarding experience based on data and an ever-evolving business. 
Are passionate about partnering with restaurants to help grow their businesses
Have the ability to perform audits and compile & communicate feedback in an effort to improve culinary and operational quality.
Love to build processes, playbooks, and can adjust training materials and methods to accommodate onboarding needs.

Were excited about you because...

You're self-motivated, positive, and a team player. You work well with others, but also excel in roles with little oversight - relying on your own drive and self-discipline.
You're scrappy. You are willing to do whatever it takes to get the job done whether it's digging into a new process to determine how best to communicate it to Host Partners or helping troubleshoot a technical issue.
You have 3+ years of experience cooking and managing in a high-volume kitchen environment including fast-casual, QSR, and from-scratch restaurants
You have 2+ years of experience in a field training or training development role, ideally with a restaurant group.
You have a knack for organization and are proficient in Google Docs/Sheets. You are a data-driven decision maker who is comfortable compiling your findings in documentation that can be shared with the broader team.
You are willing to travel and be on-site in dynamic restaurant environments

RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Leave team plays a crucial role in supporting DoorDashs leave/accommodation programs and time off policies. Our team ensures that employees receive the necessary guidance, support, and resources throughout their leave, whether related to medical, family, or workplace accommodation needs. Working with employees, managers, and HR, we support various types of leaves, ensuring adherence to company policies and relevant laws. Our focus is on enhancing operational efficiency and effectiveness, and we are looking for someone who shares this drive.
About the Role
We are seeking a Leave Administrator who plays a pivotal role in managing the transactional aspects of leaves of absence and accommodation requests, ensuring meticulous adherence to policies and regulations. This position partners closely with the internal Leave and Accommodation Business Partners, supporting our strategic initiatives by handling the detailed, operational execution of leave and accommodation processes. This position reports into the Manager of Leaves.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will..

Manage the full cycle of leave administration process,, focusing on the transactional activities involved in designating FMLA-qualifying leaves.
Process and track all types of leave, including FMLA, STD, parental leave, and other company-specific leaves.
Offer guidance and support to employees about their leave entitlements and required documentation.
Serve as an initial resource for employees and managers with leave and accommodation related questions.
Oversee ongoing leave cases, handle extensions, and manage return-to-work processes, coordinating with managers to address workforce planning impacts.
Act as a key operational partner to our cross-functional business partners, facilitating their strategic objectives by handling the detailed administrative tasks associated with leave requests and accommodations.
Propose, formulate, and implement program policies and operational procedures that ensure compliance with relevant laws and regulations.
Process and manage HR records and transactions related to leaves and accommodations in HRIS systems, ensuring accuracy and timely data entry.
Collaborate effectively with HR partners, and other stakeholders to maintain cooperative relationships and align program activities with organizational goals.
Work closely with payroll to ensure accurate advice to pay and assist in coordinating company PTO, sick leave, and other leave payments (e.g., STD, LTD, workers' compensation).

Were excited about you because...

You have 2-3 years of experience in Leaves and Accommodation administration management in multiple settings.
You have a background in handling complex leave and accommodation cases, including conducting detailed interactive discussions and managing complex leave scenarios.
You exhibit excellent written and verbal communication skills and can effectively communicate complex information to various stakeholders.
You have demonstrated the ability to analyze information, make informed decisions, and handle sensitive situations with empathy and discretion.
You build strong relationships with HR partners and business leaders and can make thoughtful recommendations to resolve complex requests.

Nice to haves:

Familiarity with leave management software (e.g., AbsenceSoft) and experience with advice-to-pay processes and payroll systems like ADP.
Understanding of advanced leave laws and regulatory changes, enabling you to make recommendations for program improvements.
Certification in Disability Management, Leave Management, or Rehabilitation Counseling
Previous experience with insourced leave and accommodation programs

Title: DashMart Team Member - Lower Manhattan
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. Customers order their convenience, grocery, retail, and prepared foods in the DoorDash app, and our team members fulfill orders in a real, brick-and-mortar store, for our Dashers to deliver. Were open early and close late - some sites even run 24/7!
About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Inventory receiving and management: Accurately receive and stock inventory, ensuring all products are accounted for and safeguarded against loss or theft. Monitor product quality and freshness and ensure proper product rotation. Follow all HACCP, food-handling and spoilage management processes.
Pick, pack and sort: Use technology similar to smartphone devices to scan packages, pick and stage orders, and conduct handoffs to Dashers.
Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Youre excited about this opportunity because...

Market Competitive pay (10pm-6am will receive a $2 increase in pay)
AM/PM/Overnight shifts available
Opportunity for pay increases twice a year based upon performance
Paid time off (PTO) and sick leave
Health benefits starting Day 1 for full-time employees (Medical, Dental, & Vision)
Gym membership reimbursement (up to $75/month)
Monthly DashPass subscription (including access to HBO Max and Lyft discounts for full-time employees)
Employee Assistance Program
Career advancement opportunities

We're excited about you because...

You have great communication skills, willing to learn, and are a problem solver 
You thrive within a team environment and enjoy a variety of duties
You have experience within retail, customer service, food and beverage, administrative, healthcare or similar industries where you perform a variety of tasks
You have customer facing experience and love to delight customers
Youre able to be on your feet and handle warehouse duties including lifting up to 50 pounds (depending on site requirements) with or without accommodations. 
You have a minimum of a High school diploma or GED equivalent and are 18 years of age or older.

Title: Machine Learning Engineer - ETA Team
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Join us in building the world's most reliable on-demand logistics engine for delivery! We are bringing on a talented Machine Learning Engineer to help us develop and improve the ETA models that power DoorDash's three-sided marketplace of consumers, merchants, and dashers. As a fundamental area of investment for DoorDash, ETA has among the coolest problems to solve at scale and creates a major impact on the company and its businesses.
About the Role
As a Machine Learning Engineer, you will have the opportunity to leverage our robust data and machine learning infrastructure to develop inference and optimization ETA models that impact millions of users across our three audiences and tackle our most challenging business problems. You will work with other data scientists, engineers, and product managers to develop and iterate on models to help us grow our business and provide better service quality for our customers.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Build Deep Learning models for next-generation ETA that provide the most accurate, scalable and robust time predictions and enhance the consumer, merchant, and dasher experience.
Own the modeling life cycle end-to-end, including feature creation, model development and testing, experimentation, monitoring and explainability, and model maintenance. 
Being exposed to new opportunities where ETA can be used as a lever that benefits new business, new markets, and new regions.
You can find out more on our ML blog post here.

Were excited about you because...

High-energy and confident  you keep the mission in mind, take ideas and help them grow using data and rigorous testing, show evidence of progress and then double down
Youre an owner  driven, focused, and quick to take ownership of your work
Humble  youre willing to jump in and youre open to feedback
Adaptable, resilient, and able to thrive in ambiguity  things change quickly in our fast-paced startup and youll need to be able to keep up!
Growth-minded  youre eager to expand your skill set and excited to carve out your career path in a hyper-growth setting
Desire for impact  ready to take on a lot of responsibility and work collaboratively with your team

Experience

1+ years of industry experience post PhD or 3+ years of industry experience post graduate degree of developing advanced machine learning models with business impact.
M.S., or PhD. in Computer Science, Statistics, or other related quantitative fields.
Strong background in Deep Learning and OSS ML technologies such as Spark, PyTorch, Airflow with hands-on experience in production.
Demonstrated expertise with programming languages e.g. python and machine learning libraries e.g., Spark MLLib, PyTorch, etc.
Deep understanding of complex systems such as Marketplaces, and domain knowledge in two or more of the following: Deep Learning, Reinforcement Learning, Operations Research / Optimization, and LLM.
Experience of shipping production-grade ML models and optimization systems, and designing sophisticated experimentation techniques.
You are located or are planning to relocate to San Francisco, CA, Sunnyvale, CA, or Seattle, WA.

Title: Senior Associate,  Community Response
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DoorDashs Community Response team is dedicated to ensuring a safe and high-quality experience for everyone on our platform, including consumers, Dashers, and merchants. As part of the Trust & Safety organization, we respond swiftly, effectively, and with professionalism to a wide range of safety incidents, such as personal safety concerns, threats, property damage, food safety issues, discrimination, and interpersonal disputes. Trust and Safety success relies on our team being able to identify harmful situations, communicate empathetically with survivors and make quick decisions to mitigate future risk.  Our goal is to provide exceptional support to those affected by incidents on the platform and restore confidence in our platform.
At DoorDash, we believe in fostering a culture of meaningful connection, collaboration, and professional growth through in-office interactions. This position requires an in-office presence at the DoorDash corporate office in Tempe and the employee must live within a commutable 50 miles from the office. In-office days are determined by the business and can change based on business needs. Connect with the recruiter to determine what the in-office requirement for this role is.
About the Role
As a Senior Associate of DoorDash's Community Response team, you will play a critical role in ensuring the safety and well-being of our platforms community by driving key initiatives that support the Trust & Safety organizations objectives. You will leverage your program management expertise and tactical execution skills to implement high-impact projects aimed at strengthening our safety response capabilities.
In this role, youll partner closely with cross-functional teamsincluding Product, Safety Strategy & Operations, Trust Strategy & Operations, Policy, Fraud, Quality Assurance, Support, and Legalto refine safety protocols, resolve process inefficiencies, and enhance the platform experience for all users. Your focus will be on optimizing our safety response processes, managing escalations, and ensuring our resources are current and aligned with best practices.
Success in this position requires a sharp eye for detail combined with the ability to distill complex information into actionable insights for leadership and stakeholders. Your ability to blend data-driven decision-making with a deep understanding of safety will be key to identifying risks and implementing solutions that reinforce trust across our community. If you have a passion for safety, strong technical skills, and the drive to make a meaningful impact, wed love to have you on the team.
You will report into the Senior Manager on our Community Response team in our Trust and Safety organization.
You're excited about this opportunity because you will...

Develop expertise in how DoorDash's processes and safety protocols work, as well as how to use them to respond effectively to incidents and achieve positive outcomes for our community, including mitigating risk and restoring user confidence.
Partner with multiple internal and external teamsincluding Product, Legal, Support, Policy, and S&Oto execute critical safety response projects while understanding and accounting for the impact of each initiative on upstream and downstream safety processes.
Oversee continued operational success by managing implementation of expansion projects such as international efforts, live escalations, and safety response optimization
Determine project goals and outcomes that align with the broader safety strategy, while tracking the effectiveness of response initiatives and providing regular updates to leadership on how these efforts are enhancing the safety experience across the platform.
Build detailed project plans that outline tasks, resources, dependencies, and timelines to ensure seamless implementation of safety response improvements, prioritizing initiatives that bolster the protection and security of all DoorDash users.
Directly connect with those impacted by incidents on the platform to understand how we can best serve them and restore confidence in the platform (this includes on the phone/chat/email).

We're excited about you because...

You have a proven track record in managing large-scale projects from concept to completion, with the ability to lead cross-functional initiatives, prioritize multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.
You have strong experience handling high-stakes incidents with a calm, clear-headed approach.
You have demonstrated the ability to analyze data to identify trends, assess risks, and create actionable insights. Proficiency in tools like SQL, Sheets, or other analytics platforms is a strong plus.
You have exceptional communication skills, both verbal and written, with the ability to present complex information to various audiences, including senior leadership
You have experience working with diverse teams
You have the ability to respond empathetically to individuals impacted by safety incidents, understanding their perspective while ensuring resolutions are consistent with the companys values and policies.
You have strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with a proactive mindset to anticipate and mitigate potential risks before they escalate.
You have comfort working in a fast-paced, ambiguous environment where priorities can shift quickly.
You have comfort with leveraging technology to optimize safety protocols and workflows.

DashMart is looking for a motivated and experienced individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations.  In this role, you will work within a local-fulfillment center supporting Site Management running great shifts and delegating tasks. As a Shift Lead, you will have shift responsibility for fulfilling orders in a warehouse environment, maintaining inventory, and in some locations, this involves preparing food in a light-prep kitchen.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

You have a high school diploma or GED equivalent. A college diploma is even better but not required. 
You are at least 18 years of age.
You're organized and proficient in Google Docs and Google Sheets.

Market Competitive pay

The Outside Sales team has been the face of DoorDash to our merchant partners since our founding in 2013. Travel and expand the DoorDash footprint in emerging markets  untapped markets across the country primarily in rural areas.

About the Role
DashMart is looking for a motivated individual that excels in fast-paced, physical environments, and is excited to roll up their sleeves and actively engage in day-to-day operations. In this role, your tasks will include:

Delight customers: Communicate clearly and pleasantly with customers through the app when substitution approvals are needed.
Warehouse organization and safety: Maintain a safe working environment by performing all duties in compliance with DashMart safety and security standards. Complete all cleaning and warehouse organization tasks as assigned by management. 
Be a team player: Contribute to a positive working environment by bringing the DoorDash one team, one fight value to life in all you do. Work with the teams goals in mind, sharing ideas, opportunities and challenges where appropriate. Engage in professional and respectful interactions with team members and customers, ensuring a positive and safe atmosphere in the warehouse.
Runner/Dasher coordination [where applicable]: Guide Runners and Dashers to pickup locations. Support parking lot management by directing traffic, collecting racks and carts, and performing other duties as assigned by management.
 Food preparation [where applicable]: Assist in light preparation of hot and/or cold foods and pre-packaging food items for staging and delivery. Willing to learn basic kitchen skills.

Title: Architect, Workforce Management
RoleDescription:
About the Team
Join us at DoorDash, where our people are our most valuable asset. As a member of our People Technology team, you'll play an instrumental role in building simple experiences with technology. We're looking for a talented Architect, Workforce Management to join our team and work closely with our business partners to drive key business decisions and innovate in critical tools such as Workday. Your contributions will help shape the future of our organization as we continue to push the boundaries of what's possible.
About the Role
The DoorDash People Technology team is looking for an Architect, Workforce Management with demonstrated experience and knowledge in system design and strategy for labor forecasting, scheduling, and timekeeping for a global organization. As an Architect, Workforce Management you will interact directly with senior leaders and cross-functional partners across DoorDash to capture requirements while designing lasting solutions with People Technology.  This role will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and maintaining secure and scalable workforce management architectures for our People organization. As part of a solution architecture team, you will lead the end-to-end design of scalable, integrated solutions that align with business needs, technology standards, and long-term strategic goals.
This role will report to the Manager of People Architecture.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Drive strategic architectural decisions for a high-impact workforce transformation initiative
Design end-to-end solutions across multiple global organizations at DoorDash that address labor demand forecasting, scheduling, timekeeping, and absence management.
Align architectural decisions with broader enterprise strategy and secure executive sponsorship and stakeholder alignment across business units.
Solve real-world workforce challenges like demand forecasting and scheduling accuracy with existing tools.
Shape scalable, future-ready solutions that reduce operational complexity and enhance workforce agility.
Conduct regular audits and assessments to identify and mitigate risks
Lead global tool selection review and design of workforce management solution
Create solutions that drive recognized value faster for business partners
Provides guidance and subject matter expertise on workforce management tools and reporting capabilities and limitations.
Time & Labor subject matter expert solving complex problems, while keeping compliance top of mind.
Leverage business knowledge and expertise to identify opportunities for process improvements.
Support system troubleshooting, configuration, testing, and deployment of assigned applications to meet requirements, timelines, and execution standards.
Identify risks, trade-offs, and opportunities for optimization throughout the vendor evaluation and implementation phases.
Ability to design new solutions based on business strategy and outcomes.

Were excited about you because...

You have 5-7 years of work experience in workforce management solutions (e.g. Quinyx, Assembled, Workday) implementation/configuration, both domestic and international. 
Extensive experience cross delivering on one or more of the following Workday HCM modules: Core HCM, Time & Labor, Absence Management, and Reporting
Experience as a lead consultant on system implementations
Experience with roadmaps across global organizations.
Background working with business-critical systems and managing change in operational environments.
Quinyx developer (plus)
You are a self-motivated and rapid learner
You are outcomes-oriented, always evaluating whether our team's activities are achieving the desired, measurable impact, and continuously iterating to ensure the best solution
You are an owner, always looking for opportunities to learn and better your work product
You are comfortable and thrive in a fast-paced, continually changing team-oriented environment and able to manage multiple deadlines simultaneously.
You have a BA/BS degree in quantitative or business fields, or equivalent work experience
You have an analytical mindset and a People First mentality with demonstrated ability to work through complex, ambiguous problems using data and creating configuration solutions based on that data
You have strong written/verbal communication and presentation skills

We expect this position to be filled by 9/12/25

Title: Sr. Product Designer, Merchant Platform
Location: San Francisco, CA; New York City, NY
RoleDescription:
About the Team
The Merchant Design team crafts the products and services that merchants rely on every day to succeed on DoorDash. We aim to be an essential partner for every merchant, whether by enhancing in-store operations or streamlining business management. Our teams purpose is to design seamless, engaging experiences that support merchants at every stage of their journey. With a commitment to design thinking, creativity, and innovation, we bring the heart and soul of DoorDash to life, ensuring the user experience is filled with unique, memorable interactions.
About the Role
As a senior product designer on the Merchant Platform team, you will play a pivotal role in making merchants more successful on our platform. You will collaborate closely with product managers, engineers, researchers, and other designers to create intuitive solutions that address the unique growth needs of our merchants. By bringing a user-centric mindset that balances business needs, you will establish platforms and frameworks for partner teams to grow adoption, build new zero-to-one features, as well as drive iterative experiment-driven optimizations. Success in this role requires being able to navigate low- and high-altitude work simultaneously, balancing short-term tactical experiments with long-term strategic bets. Youll need to be passionate about helping merchants succeed, as youll be expected to drive design strategy with sometimes ambiguous starting points, leveraging data, running experiments, and building business cases to influence the roadmap of the team.
You'll report to our Director of Design, Merchant Experience. This role is hybrid, working certain days a week onsite and the rest working from home.
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead the user experience of products end-to-end, including contributing to product strategy, running design sprints, and crafting visions
Work cross-functionally with product managers, engineers, and other disciplines to build and ship your designs
Deliver and refine clear storytelling around product needs and opportunities
Create, collaborate, and refine flows, prototypes, and high-fidelity visuals
Design and ship high-quality product improvements

Were excited about you because...

You are a senior-level IC with 7+ years of work experience
You enjoy complex problem spaces, and bring clarity to your teams through your mastery of the design process (and the occasional design sprint)
You are passionate about leading product strategy and vision for new product areas 
You skillfully balance strategy, research, interaction design, and visual design to achieve elegant solutions
You value high quality well crafted visual design, and care about the details

Title: Site Manager
RoleDescription:
About the Team
DashMart is part of the New Verticals division with Doordash and we are a local-fulfillment center owned and operated by DoorDash, offering customers fast, reliable, and high quality delivery. 
About the Role
In this role, youll manage a 5-15k sq ft distribution center, the local warehouse operating team, and be responsible for ensuring we maintain high quality for our customers. 
Youre excited about this opportunity because you will...

Lead: Recruit, lead, coach & retain a high-performing team of Shift Leads (3+) and Operations Associates (6+). Set your team up for success to work safely and productively. As a leader, you will be responsible for building a strong, positive culture and will be accountable for driving strong employee satisfaction scores. Youll partner with your Shift Leads to effectively delegate daily tasks and ensure high performance from your team. 
Own: You will own the day-to-day operations of one of our DashMart warehouses, and in some locations, includes preparing food in a light-prep kitchen, ensuring the site processes run smoothly, efficiently and safely. Youll own scheduling and be responsible for managing a labor budget. You will be responsible for ensuring your warehouse meets site-level metric goals. 
Delight customers: Lead your team in providing our customers with the best possible experience on each and every order. You will be responsible for maintaining key quality metrics including order accuracy and fulfillment speed. Work cross-functionally with central teams including our inventory and training teams to provide your team with the tools and resources to achieve this goal.  
Strategize: Use data to identify pain-points or areas of inefficiency within our warehouse and current processes. Design, build and execute process improvement projects to improve our warehouse operations, quality metrics, and the employee experience.

Were excited about you because... 

Youre a proven leader. You have managed high-performance teams of 10+ employees
You act like an owner. You do what it takes to support a 24/7 business across multiple shifts. Youre excited to have ownership over a new and rapidly growing business.
You solve problems from first principles.  Youre excited to solve problems in innovative ways, and you resist this is how its always been done thinking
Youre unafraid of ambiguity.  Rapid change and learning is exciting to you, and you thrive in ambiguous, startup environments
Youre analytical. You let data win arguments. You are a data-first problem solver and you have experience using Excel or Google Sheets to analyze data, including using basic formulas and creating pivot tables. 
You have 3+ years experience: In Operations, Warehouse Logistics, Retail Management, Fulfillment, or related field
You have 3+ years of experience managing a team
You have a college degree, or relevant professional work experience
You have flexibility in your schedule. As the leader of the site, you will need to ensure your team and the site is fully supported, requiring some late night and weekend availability.
